{{also|zusammen-}} ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|[[zesamene]], [[zesamne]], [[zesamen]]||together}}, from {{inh|de|goh|zisamane||together}}. From {{prefix|de|zu|t1=to|sammen||t2=together}} (these days, {{m|de|sammen}} is only found in compounds), form {{der|de|gem-pro|*samana||together}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*sem-||together, one}}. Cognate with {{cog|enm|to-samen||together}}. Related to obsolete {{cog|en|sam||together}}, whose earlier form was {{m|en|samen}}. {{cog|nl|tezamen||together}} has been formed in a similar fashion, with its contracted form being {{m|nl|samen}} and its ancestral form {{m|dum|tsamen}}. Also cognate with {{cog|sco|samin||together}}, {{cog|da|sammen||together}}, {{cog|sv|samman||together}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/tsuˈzamən/|[tsuˈzamən]|[tsuˈzamm̩]}} {{a|standard}} * {{IPA|de|/tsəˈzamən/}} {{a|colloquial variant}} * {{IPA|de|/ˈtsam(ən)/}} {{a|colloquial in Bavaria, Austria}} * {{audio|de|De-zusammen.ogg|Audio}} * {{hyphenation|de|zu|sam|men}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # [[together]], [[jointly]] #* '''1903''', {{w|Fanny zu Reventlow}}, ''[[s:de:Ellen Olestjerne|Ellen Olestjerne]]'', in ''Franziska Gräfin zu Reventlow: Gesammelte Werke'', Albert Langen, page 526: #*: Trotz all dieser Bitternisse war es noch ein wunderbar schöner Sommer, den die drei Freunde '''zusammen''' verlebten. #*:: Despite all these bitter feelings, it was yet a wonderfully beautiful summer, which the three friends spent together. ====Synonyms==== * {{q|all restricted to certain contexts}} ** {{l|de|beieinander}} ** {{l|de|gemeinsam}} ** {{l|de|miteinander}} ** {{l|de|vereint}} ** {{l|de|zueinander}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|getrennt}} * {{l|de|gegeneinander}} ====Derived terms==== {{der4|de |sich zusammenbrauen |sich zusammendrängen |sich zusammenfalten
